application.name: Jira
application.description: JIRA is an issue and project tracker for running on-premises or available as a hosted application. It sits at the center of the development team, connecting the people and the work being done. Track bugs and tasks, link issues to related source code, plan agile development, monitor activity, report on project status, and more.

ns8:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -x
if [ -n "$proxy" ]; then echo -e 'http_proxy="http://'$proxy':'$proxy_port'/"\nftp_proxy="ftp://'$proxy':'$proxy_port'/"\nhttps_proxy="https://'$proxy':'$proxy_port'/"' >> /etc/environment echo -e 'Acquire::http::proxy "http://'$proxy':'$proxy_port'/";\nAcquire::ftp::proxy "ftp://'$proxy':'$proxy_port'/";\nAcquire::https::proxy "https://'$proxy':'$proxy_port'/";' >> /etc/apt/apt.conf fi
sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get -y --force-yes install expect
wget http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/atlassian-jira-5.1-x64.bin sudo chmod a+x atlassian-jira-5.1-x64.bin
/usr/bin/expect <<EOD
spawn sudo ./atlassian-jira-5.1-x64.bin
expect "This will install JIRA 5.1 on your computer." send "\r" expect "Please choose one of the following:" send "\r" expect "Where should JIRA 5.1 be installed?" send "$location\r" expect "Default location for JIRA data" send "$default_location\r" expect "Configure which ports JIRA will use." send "2\r" expect "HTTP Port Number" send "$config_port\r" expect "Control Port Number" send "$control_port\r" expect "Install JIRA as Service?" send "\r" expect "Install JIRA as Service?"
EOD
echo ---install success...
